text:
Here's what this guy wrote, right? I 
found this child hiding in the closet.

I notified the owner, but
he seemed unconcerned.
He said I can keep it.
What's that supposed to mean? A real kid?
Then he attached a photo.
Right? Here's the photo.

He's gotta be screwing with you.
Are you sure that's not the guy's kid?
No.
Why don't you read him your response?
Here's what I'm thinking of writing the guy back, okay?
I don't understand what the problem is. I told you it wasn't mine. And you could keep it if you wanted to.
I thought I was being cool.
You paid nothing extra for it.
Why complain?

You call 911. Have the child, 
you know.

Well, that's not on me as the homeowner. Right?
- No. Of course.

I would recommend please call 911.
- I thought I was doing the right thing.
I was like, dude, keep it.
I'm not gonna get a cage to trap the kid.
It's not my responsibility, right?
He's agreeing.

He didn't pay for it and
he didn't take it.

As far as I know, the child's still there. 
- Really?

But why complain?
So this is good to send, right?

Yeah, yeah, yeah.
It's great. It's good to send.
